subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Thursday, April 19, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

President Clinton: Hillary will be 'fine' if she
loses

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former President
Bill Clinton told CNN Thursday his wife will have no qualms
about returning to the Senate if she loses her presidential
bid.

Note: Watch Larry King's full interview
with former President Clinton tonight at 9 p.m. E.T. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/president-clinton-hillary-will-be-fine.html

***

Gonzales: No partisan politics at
Justice

Attorney General Alberto Gonzales
defended his leadership of the Justice Department as free from
partisan politics in a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing
Thursday over the firings of eight U.S. attorneys last year.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/04/19/gonzales.testimony/index.html

***

White House
aide: Attorney Gen. 'going down in flames'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- White House insiders say Attorney Gen.
Alberto Gonzales is in trouble.

These sources,
involved in the Administration's discussions about the
deliberations, say two senior level White House aides described
Gonzales testimony as "going down in flames," "not doing
himself any favors," and "predictable."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/white-house-aides-attorney-gen-going.html

***

White House: President 'pleased' with
Gonzales' testimony

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The
White House said Thursday President Bush was "pleased" with
Attorney Gen. Alberto Gonzales's testimony.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/white-house-president-pleased-with.html

***

Specter questions Gonzales' press-conference
preparation

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Arlen
Specter, the ranking Republican on the Senate Judiciary
committee, had some tough questions for embattled Attorney
General Alberto Gonzales at Wednesday's hearings.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/specter-questions-gonzales-press.html

***

Coburn tells Gonzales he should resign

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Attorney Gen. Alberto Gonzales
faced a new resignation call during his Senate Judiciary
Committee hearing on the U.S. attorney firings Thursday -- from
Oklahoma Sen. Tom Coburn.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/coburn-tells-gonzales-he-should-resign.html

***

Dean Internet guru signs on with
Edwards

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Joe Trippi, the
Democratic strategist who once ran Howard Dean's presidential
campaign and was largely credited for the Vermont Democrats'
success raising money online, has signed on with former North
Carolina Sen. John Edwards' presidential bid.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/dean-internet-guru-signs-on-with.html

***

California Congressman resigning committee post
after home searched in corruption probe

WASHINGTON (CNN) --Rep. John Doolittle, R-California, will
step down temporarily from his post on the House Appropriations
Committee, two Republican congressional aides said Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/california-congressman-resigning.html

***

Boehner: Doolittle 'courageous' for stepping down
from Appropriations Committee

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- House Minority Leader John Boehner, R-Ohio, commended
California Rep. John Doolittle Thursday for "having the courage
to do the right thing" in resigning his post from the House
Appropriations Committee.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/boehner-doolittle-courageous-for.html

***

McCain sings 'Bomb, bomb Iran'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- At a town hall meeting in South
Carolina Wednesday, Arizona Sen. John McCain was asked if there
is a plan to attack Iran. McCain began his answer by changing
the words to a classic Beach Boys' song.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-sings-bomb-bomb-iran.html

***

Giuliani remembers Oklahoma City bombing, invokes
Virginia Tech shootings

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani commemorated the 12th
anniversary of the Oklahoma City bombing Thursday, comparing
that tragedy to the Virginia Tech shootings earlier in the
week.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/giuliani-remembers-oklahoma-city.html

***

McCain heckled over gun rights stance

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. John McCain was heckled Wednesday
night by a South Carolina town hall audience member when he
reiterated his support for gun rights in the wake of the
Virginia Tech shootings.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-heckled-over-gun-rights-stance.html
